alert.note: Alert for Municipality of Skagway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 27 at 2:33AM AKST until January 27 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Snow transitioned to rain at sea level near Haines and Skagway. Freezing rain potential will continue as warm air edge northward. Heavy snow continues at higher elevations. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected. Light freezing rain at lower elevations possible early Saturday morning. Total snow accumulations of up to 13 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph Friday night. * WHERE...Klondike Highway above 1000 Feet. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Skagway is changing over to rain with a brief period of freezing rain still possible as it transitions. Snow levels expected to rise up to 2000 feet by Saturday afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
